Description: Wall sherd (mended from six fragments) North Ionian black-figured pottery bowl; interior: glazed black; parts of four friezes in added red and white (leaf elements mostly alternating colour) separated by red bands lined in white: scrap of palmette; chain of opposed palmettes; band of alternating lotus flowers and tongues; nothing preserved of lowest frieze; exterior (much worn), friezes separated by bands with superimposed red bands lined in white; from top: maeander band; animal frieze with goat running right, head turned back, with dotted rosette filling ornament; hook meander band; lowest frieze of lotus flower and bud.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ3, Φ4 or Φ7.
Curator's comments: From same vessel as 1888,0601.532a-f and h, and Oxford G119.39.
Bibliographic references: Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 243, no.6)
Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (pp. 42, 48, pl. VIII, no. 1-2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.187)
